column2: "value": "Charles Forrest Bybee   ||   Visit Guest Book \r\nCHARLES FORREST\r\nBYBEE
column3:
90
Electronic Engineer

WINTER HAVEN - Mr. Charles Forrest Bybee
column6: FL died of natural causes Wednesday (Sept. 15
column7: 2010) at Lifecare Center of Winter Haven
column8: FL.\r\nHe was born in Davis County
column12: the son of Pearl J. and Cecil Zellers Bybee. He graduated from Moulton High School in Moulton
column13: Iowa in 1938 and from the Capitol Radio Engineering Institute in Washington
column14: DC in 1948.\r\nHe is survived by his beloved wife
column15: Sadie Stafford Bybee; one son Robert D. Bybee of Suburban Atlanta
column16: GA; one stepdaughter Carol Emery of Lake Wales
column17: FL; favorite nephew Reed Thompson and three nieces. He was preceded in death by his first wife Frances Mehann Bybee in 2000 and his parents
column19: and two brothers Clint E. and J. Robert (Bob) Bybee.\r\nHe was employed by the Bybee Brothers Grocery in Moulton
column20: Iowa until he enlisted in the US Army early in WWII. He served as a radio operator in the Signal Corps on the Canol Project in the Northwest Territories
column21: Canada and later in a Signal Corps Intelligence Unit. Before retirement he was employed by the Western Electric Company
column23: and for twenty five years by the Central Intelligence Agency in Washington. He wrote and published a memoir and genealogical history of the Bybee family
column25: \" in 1995; he also published a volume of his poetry
column26: \"Life Is A Poem\" in 2002. A number of his poems and writings have been printed in newspapers and national anthologies. He is listed in Who's Who in America.\r\nMemorial Services to be held on Monday
column28: 2010 at 11:00 am at the Spring Haven Retirement Home
column31: FL.\r\nCondolences may be sent to the family at www.ott-laughlin.com."}
